name: BAE Systems
title: Senior Quality & Capability Specialist
description: senior quality & capability specialist grade: 5 location: riyadh job purpose bae systems is the uk government’s nominated prime contractor under the government-to-government arrangements that are in place to provide equipment, support and training to saudi arabia. we provide maintenance of royal saudi air force aircraft and train rsaf personnel safely in a training environment in how to use their aircraft, equipment and weapons. bae systems saudi arabia is committed to supporting the saudi arabian national agenda including saudisation and the training and development of saudi national capability through the growth of the saudi national partner companies thereby reinforcing industrialisation and partnerships. job accountabilities support carry out quality training needs analysis (tna) across the business and identify suitable training courses to meet the assessed requirement. coordinate on quality training including qdy assessment and gap analysis develop a training plan and liaise with kpc to ensure delivery of training plan the senior capability specialist is responsible for conducting project / function activities and tasks as directed by the line manager. will be required to provide support, to quality policies and process, the application and evaluation of quality processes, helping ensuring the satisfaction of customer, internal and regulatory requirements for quality, helping elimination of quality risk through these approaches to bae systems saudi arabia business. will be required to lead and conduct, process confirmations, audits, assessment and investigations into product and/or process failures in line with business needs. · job holder will provide an interface with the internal and external customers on quality assurance matters and shall be an efficient communicator with confidence and experience in dealing with these parties. · as required, represent the quality department as project quality assurance specialist assuring that contractual quality conditions and company requirements, including lifecycle management (lcm) requirements, are achieved and undertake product or process certification activities as necessary. · as required, produce and prepare quality plans in line with lcm requirements. · comprehensive reports are produced assuring function and project activities are addressed to the customer’s satisfaction. · as required, responsible for the day-to-day liaison, tracking and reporting on quality issues and resolutions through written reports and presentations. · as required, assess business areas for compliance to quality requirements, preform audits, report preparation/issue and follow-up actions to agreed timescales. · as required, carry out ‘guide’ duties for 3rd party assessors and resolve assessor queries as they arise. · as required, identify and deliver departmental training needs for the quality assurance team. · as required, the job holder will provide quality assurance support to bae systems saudi arabia business, involved in the supply of customer deliverable equipment and services. recruitment specification · hr experience in a mid-size organization in the aviation/defence industry preferred · a basic understanding of hr processes and how they interact with others functions · the jobholder shall have quality background and a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a quality / assurance environment. · excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. · iso 9001 or as 9100 auditor experience · knowledge and experience of quality management system · strong understanding and experience of assurance, governance and compliance activities and processes. · proactive planning, organising and implementing tasks that are required to ensure that bae systems saudi arabia quality standards conform both with customer (internal & external) and regulatory body requirements · the jobholder has a direct impact on the business through their entertainment, cultural and lifestyle destination. as a multibillion-dollar project, it will encompass vast infrastructure development, hospitality, retail and service sectors, which requires effective and large scale management of supplier relationships and supply chain risks. the senior associate - srm will support the implementation of the org's srm agenda. this comprises onboarding suppliers, ensuring complete and up-to-date documentation, acting as the org's point-of-contact to the suppliers, providing internal stakeholders with intelligence available on registered suppliers, and tracking supplier performance metrics across all projects within the org. 1. supplier relationship management: support suppliers in onboarding onto the organization's srm platform, collecting and systematically storing required documents. support communications with suppliers, sharing relevant resources, providing guidance on using the srm platform, and ensuring they update their documents and contact information regularly. conduct data analyses to recommend suitable interaction models for each supplier, according to the size and nature of their partnership with the org. store supplier information for the org and provide business teams with supplier information as required. 2. supplier performance metrics oversight: conduct performance analyses to track supplier performance against predefined key performance indicators (kpis), such as quality, timelines, and cost efficiency. support generation of supplier performance reports to assess trends and identify areas for improvement. support regular performance reviews and audits to ensure compliance with contracts and agreed standards. 3. team management, learning & development oversee and support junior team members, ensuring professional growth through mentorship. foster a collaborative and high-performance culture within the srm & scr team. requirements 3+ years of experience in supplier relationship management & supply chain roles, ideally in large-scale projects such as construction, real estate, or urban development. bachelor's or master's degree in accounting, law, finance, business, or related fields. preferred: certified professional in supply management (cpsm), certified supply chain professional (cscp), certified purchasing manager (cpm) experience with ksa regulatory requirements and familiarity with vision 2030 goals is highly desirable. strong analytical skills with the ability to identify and address risks effectively. proven track record of working in cross-collaborative environments. fluency in english is required, with proficiency in arabic highly desirable. understanding of the local cultural and business landscape in saudi arabia through work experience in the region preferred. job id 44666ab792
label: none

name: Qiddiya Investment Company
title: Specialist - Strategic Procurement(COR 932)
description: specialist - strategic procurement(cor 932) the organization is a flagship gigaproject under saudi arabia's vision 2030 initiative, aiming to create a world-class entertainment, cultural and lifestyle destination. as a multibillion-dollar project, it will encompass vast infrastructure development, hospitality, retail and service sectors, requiring robust strategic procurement management. the specialist will support activities for development and execution of procurement strategies across key categories such as building materials, design consultants, contractor services, ff&e, os&e, etc., ensuring alignment with the gigaproject's strategic goals. this role is pivotal in aligning category strategies with business objectives and ensuring strategic and operational procurement excellence across critical categories. the specialist will also support the strategic procurement team in cross-functional engagements with development & procurement teams for strategic procurement planning, supplier relationship management, and operational execution for assigned categories. 1. category strategy development support development and implementation of category strategies aligned with the gigaproject's procurement objectives, focusing on cost optimization, quality, supply security, and supplier performance. conduct detailed analyses of appropriate levers across categories to extract maximum value from the procurement spend, including non-commercial levers such as specification improvement, partnerships, etc., identifying opportunities for strategic sourcing, supplier consolidation, volume purchasing and value engineering. support market analyses to identify trends, cost-saving opportunities, and strategic negotiation levers. support category demand analyses to ensure category plans meet project and operational needs. 2. supplier management conduct activities supporting supplier relationship management with critical suppliers, e.g., maintaining communications, organizing meetings, gathering and providing shared data. conduct supporting analyses to develop long-term framework agreements with suppliers. support development of supplier performance monitoring frameworks and ensure adherence to quality and delivery standards. 3. operational excellence provide support to business unit (bu) procurement teams on operational procurement needs. track and report on category performance metrics, identifying areas for improvement. 4. stakeholder collaboration: support the manager in cross-functional engagements with business unit teams on category topics provide intelligence on category-related matters across central development unit (cdu) and bu teams. support in building relationships with local suppliers and contractors, driving localization efforts that meet local content and government procurement authority (lcgpa) requirements and ensure that procurement activities support local economic development. help identify suitable international suppliers to secure competitive pricing, strategic innovation partnerships and cutting-edge technologies for key project components. support bu teams in execution of category strategy as needed.\ requirements 2+ years of experience in strategic procurement or category management in large-scale projects, ideally in construction, real estate, or urban development. bachelor's or master's degree in supply chain management, engineering, or related fields. preferred: cips (chartered institute of procurement & supply), cpsm (certified professional in supply management), or cscp (certified supply chain professional). proven expertise in managing categories such as building materials, ff&e, os&e, site preparation, etc., within ksa, as well as strong negotiation skills. proven track record of working in cross-collaborative environments and ensuring differing goals and needs align with overarching organizational strategy. fluency in english is required, with proficiency in arabic highly desirable. job id 6977f4f8d4
label: none

title: AMEIA Float Glass Specialist (SME)
description: your job guardian industries is looking for a float sme to join the ameia float opex team. this role serves as a catalyst and enabler to introduce and implement the best knowledge at the sites. to achieve reliable, predictive, and safe operations throughout the region, it requires excellent collaboration skills and the deliberate application of best practices to enhance functional effectiveness. this is for a regional role for supporting ameia plants (asia, middle east, africa and india). the candidate would preferably to be based on one of these plants. you will be working with a group of 3 - 4 members who will support the float operations mainly in the ameia region. willing and able to travel internationally 30% - 40% of the time our team the float opex team works with the plants to support them on: focus on people and process safety. compliant operations excellence in conduct of operations. what you will do a float sme (subject matter expert) for tin bath, lehr & cutting in the glass manufacturing industry is responsible for ensuring the efficient operation, maintenance, and optimization of the tin bath, lehr and cutting process in a float glass production line. they support the plants in the following, but not limited to : - process optimization & control monitoring and optimizing tin bath, lehr and cutting operations to maintain glass quality and efficiency. controlling temperature, atmosphere, and tin bath chemistry to ensure defect-free glass. ensuring the correct operation of heating, cooling, and protective gas systems (e.g., nitrogen-hydrogen atmosphere). optimizing the annealing process in lehr for good control of stress in the glass and cutting, in various thickness - quality assurance & defect prevention identifying and troubleshooting defects such as bubbles, striations, or tin pickup. collaborating with quality control teams to ensure glass meets specifications. implementing process improvements to reduce waste and increase yield. ensuring good cutting quality - equipment maintenance & reliability overseeing maintenance of tin bath components like top rollers, dross box, and bath seals. ensuring the integrity of bath linings and preventing contamination. coordinating planned and unplanned maintenance activities. - safety & environmental compliance enforcing safety protocols for handling molten tin, hazardous gases and handling glass in lehr ensuring compliance with environmental regulations related to tin waste and emissions. conducting risk assessments and implementing safety improvements. - training & technical support training operators and technicians on best practices for tin bath, lehr and cutting operations. providing troubleshooting guidance and technical expertise for production teams. documenting sops (standard operating procedures) for tin bath, lehr and cutting operations. - collaboration & continuous improvement working closely with upstream (melting) and downstream (annealing, cutting) teams to ensure smooth production. implementing lean manufacturing and six sigma methodologies to improve efficiency. participating in r&d projects for process innovations. who you are (basic qualifications) knowledge/background in materials, chemical, mechanical engineering, or in materials / ceramic science with work experience in float glass or other glass manufacturing industry float glass process knowledge and experience in full scale manufacturing and development using production scale equipment experience and understanding of flat glass forming (float technology), glass annealing and cutting what will put you ahead experience with project management to include executing projects that require multi-functional involvement form implementation. lean/six sigma experience at koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. this means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. the actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. if you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy. who we are as a koch company, guardian glass is one of the world's largest manufacturers of float, value-added and fabricated glass products and solutions. we produce high-performance glass for architectural, residential, interior, transportation and technical glass applications. you'll find our glass in homes, offices and cars and in some of the world's most iconic projects. at koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company. additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. we seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results. #li-mb5

and buildings that respond to the climate emergency and contribute to more balanced, sustainable and resilient territorial development. operating in 100 countries, egis puts the expertise of its 19,500 employees at the service of its clients and develops cutting-edge innovations accessible to all projects. through its wide range of activities, egis is a key player in the collective organisation of society and the living environment of citizens all over the world. with 3,500 employees across 8 countries in the middle east, egis has delivered over 700 complex development projects, stimulating economic growth and enhancing quality of life. ranked among the top ten firms in the middle east by engineering news record (enr), egis is committed to sustainable development. the group’s operations in the middle east are built on strategic acquisitions and a deep understanding of local market conditions. egis has long history of providing comprehensive engineering, consulting, and project management services makes it a trusted partner for regional governments, investors, and developers. job description operational control centre (occ) development & validation oversee the design, implementation, and validation of the operational control centre (occ) systems. ensure compliance with project specifications, railway safety regulations, and industry standards (en 50126, iec 62290). review and validate occ construction drawings, layouts, and workstation designs. coordinate with design and integration teams to address any discrepancies in the occ setup. supervision of occ systems & subsystems oversee the installation, configuration, and integration of occ-related subsystems, including: supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) signalling & train control (cbtc, goa4) passenger information systems (pis) automatic fare collection (afc) monitoring platform screen doors (psd) control interfaces emergency and security systems (cctv, access control, fire alarm monitoring) ensure that all occ systems function in sync with monorail operations for seamless real-time monitoring and control. installation, testing & commissioning (t&c) supervise the occ setup, software deployment, and hardware installation. develop and implement testing scenarios for system validation and operational readiness. conduct simulation exercises to verify occ functionalities, including automated train operations (ato), emergency handling, and passenger flow monitoring. ensure full compliance with operational and safety standards before revenue service operations begin. integration & operational readiness ensure the seamless integration of occ with train operations, depot control, and maintenance facilities. conduct operational training sessions for occ staff to ensure familiarity with systems and procedures. work closely with stakeholders to establish standard operating procedures (sops) and emergency response protocols. provide ongoing support for occ performance optimization and reliability improvements. qualifications bachelor’s degree in railway engineering, electrical engineering, systems engineering, or a related field. minimum of 12 years of experience in occ operations, railway automation, or control center management. expertise in railway control systems, scada, cbtc, and occ software platforms. strong understanding of railway operational safety (nfpa 130, iec 62290, en 50126, en 50128, en 50129). experience in testing, commissioning, and integration of occ subsystems. excellent problem-solving, leadership, and team coordination skills. ability to work in a high-pressure environment and respond to operational challenges.

description: requisition id: 280015 relocation authorized: national/international - single telework type: full-time office/project work location: riyadh extraordinary teams building inspiring projects: since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place. differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers' objectives to create a lasting positive impact. we serve the infrastructure; nuclear, security & environmental; energy; mining & metals, and the manufacturing and technology markets. our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations. core to bechtel is our vision, values and commitments. they are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver. learn more about our extraordinary teams building inspiring projects in our impact report. project overview: bechtel has been involved over the last 80 years in some of the world’s busiest and most complex airport projects, including greenfield and brownfield developments. in the gcc, we have held significant roles on king khalid, king fahad, dubai, hamad, and muscat international airports. as we consider the future of aviation globally and in the gcc, we are very enthusiastic about the future of aviation in the kingdom of saudi arabia. we are currently considering candidates with aviation, other transportation or complex public accessible building project experience to provide project management consultancy services (including technical, commercial and construction management) for a major infrastructure project in riyadh should it be awarded to bechtel. this posting serves as an expression of interest only. job summary: in this position, you will lead a team to manage cost engineering, cost estimating, cost analysis/control, forecasting, and planning/scheduling activities for a project that requires technical skill and expertise. you will provide leadership, oversight, guidance, training, and mentoring to your team on key project procedures and risk management to ensure successful project execution and delivery. major responsibilities: coordinates and collaborates with the customer pmo to develop and maintain regular reporting and dashboards for assigned program and projects provides oversight and management of assigned reporting specialists reviewing and understanding all relevant project documents relating to cost, schedule and progress control of program of works reviewing cost commitment and expenditure information for input to computerized cost control and reporting system producing cost and schedule status reports and advising management of any forecast cost overruns and schedule delays/concerns maintaining accessible program performance registers and dashboards develops data capture approaches to monitor and report on program kpis performs any other duties as directed by the project controls director or project director preparation of monthly and quarterly finance reports, including multiple currency analysis, cashflows, hedge program, earnings methodologies, cost and revenue etc. assists with prime contract management for bechtel project services, including unit rate inflation and key personnel assists in the management of the project’s organization and staffing plans coordinates and collaborates with various teams to support and deliver all of the project’s internal reporting e.g. monthly dashboards, briefing papers, quarterly updates etc. education and experience requirements: level 1 requires bachelor's degree (or international equivalent) and 8-10 years of relevant experience or 12-14 years of relevant work experience level 2 requires bachelor's degree (or international equivalent) and 10-13 years of relevant experience or 14-17 years of relevant work experience required knowledge and skills: knowledge of project and construction market in terms of contractors, suppliers and cost management knowledge/experience in project controls and quantity surveying strong communication, leadership, planning and organization skills proven ability to develop practical 'close to real time' reporting dashboards, collaborating data from multiple sources and allowing role up-role down between individual areas, projects and programs of work proven ability to manage a multicultural team of reporting specialist across multiple projects within a program of work previous experience of collaborating closely with customer organizations and teams to ensure coordination of work product with customer requirements expert knowledge and use of business intelligence software, including power bi or similar excellent analytical skills with ability to assess large and complex data and worksheets, and proficiency in english (required) chartered quantity surveyor / membership in professional associations e.g. aace, rics or similar (advantage) knowledge of international cost management standards e.g. csi master format, bcis, gifa (advantage) knowledge of astm e2516-11 standard classification for cost estimate classification system, aace international recommended practice (advantage) knowledge of cost estimation, cost management, project and document management software such as aconex, opentext, newforma etc. experience working within ksa highly preferred total rewards/benefits for decades, bechtel has worked to inspire the next generation of employees and beyond! because our teams face some of the world's toughest challenges, we offer robust benefits to ensure our people thrive. whether it is advancing careers, delivering programs to enhance our culture, or providing time to recharge, bechtel has the benefits to build a legacy of sustainable growth. learn more at bechtel total rewards diverse teams build the extraordinary: as a global company, bechtel has long been home to a vibrant multitude of nationalities, cultures, ethnicities, and life experiences. this diversity has made us a more trusted partner, more effective problem solvers and innovators, and a more attractive destination for leading talent. we are committed to being a company where every colleague feels that they belong-where colleagues feel part of "one team," respected and rewarded for what they bring, supported in pursuing their goals, invested in our values and purpose, and treated equitably. bechtel is an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. applicants with a disability, who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, may e-mail their request to acesstmt@bechtel.com

young minds, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity at aldenham prep riyadh. to submit your application, please send your cv, cover letter, and any relevant supporting documents. for additional information, please visit our career page at: https://www.aldenhamprepriyadh.com/employment-opportunities we look forward to receiving your application and potentially welcoming you to our vibrant school community about aldenham prep riyadh aldenham prep riyadh al noura, as sahafah, riyadh 13321 saudi arabia aldenham prep school riyadh offers day education for boys and girls from 3-13 1597. boys and girls have the opportunity for a smooth transition of education from 3-18 years, focussing on developing the whole child. an excellent all round education. we are proud to be bringing this same quality of education to riyadh, and the links between the two schools will be extremely strong. such links across cultures and countries are ever more important in preparing our children for the global and interconnected world they will inhabit when they leave school. our mission statement states that: ‘at aldenham prep school, we provide a happy, nurturing and warm environment where quality learning takes place and the needs of each individual child are fulfilled.’ the school is dedicated to ensuring the flexibility for each child to develop his/her own individual abilities and academic excellences whilst meeting new challenges. in short, we provide the highest standards of education, which promote the development of all-around talents, whether they be academic, creative, or sporting. we offer all of our pupils exceptional opportunities. our boys and girls are at the heart of all we do. the children are aldenham. our key aims: to encourage a love of learning in order to aspire to academic excellence and a broad education for all pupils to foster good relationships and partnership between staff, pupils, parents and the wider community to ensure that each individual pupil is nurtured and encouraged to make the most of their own special talents to emphasise the importance of the social, moral and spiritual dimensions of community life in a modern society to provide a well planned, well organised environment giving children rich and stimulating experiences we believe very strongly in offering breadth within our curriculum, so that the all round talents of each individual child may be developed. this involves promoting the academic, creative and sporting facets of school life, as well as fostering children’s natural curiosity, in order to empower them with a life long love of learning. the timetable consists of english, maths and science, as well as ict, art, dt, geography and history. there is also specialist teaching in drama, music, pe & games school in the kingdom. arabic language, for instance, is offered from the lower school onwards and is delivered by subject specialist teachers. please click here to read aldenham's blog which details tradition of sport. games and physical education are a very important part of life at the prep school. each class has one pe lesson per week with a specialist teacher and a games afternoon. there is climbing and trampolining. aldenham in the uk: the flagship of the aldenham foundation and founded in 1597, aldenham uk is steeped in history with hundreds of years of academic excellence. it embodies endeavour as we help our students to focus on their own plans, while our teachers focus on our students. in 1596, queen elizabeth i gave royal assent for the founding of a school to richard platt, a nobleman and philanthropist. aldenham school was established and the foundation stone was laid in 1597. this school had, and still has, at its heart the concept of an all round education. unlike some needed to be developed. this focus on educating the whole child runs deep through the aldenham veins and we are proud that hundreds of years later it is still what we are famous for. aldenham school outstanding receivables in accordance with agreed terms by retaining the customer. ensure the integrity and cleanliness of the sales ledger is maintained at all times. 2. principal accountabilities 1. achievement of dos target: in conjunction with the credit control manager to set and monitor monthly collection targets by territory / provincial service centre. 2. customer service: ensure distribution of invoices and statement of account to all credit customers within a pre-determined time frame. allocation of customer payments against relevant invoices, following up on part payments where necessary. handle customer account queries by logging in sun collect note, contact more than 60 customers per day via telephone or email(if customer is not reachable on phone),encourage customer to register on mybill to get invoices online. 3. collections management : collecting on accounts, calling, dunning letters, processing customer payments, data maintenance of customer ledger 4. managing bad debts : evaluating the creditworthiness and risks of new or existing customers ; collecting on overdue accounts ; dealing with customer goodwill write-offs and overseeing customer bankruptcy matters 5. customer dispute management : dealing with queries ; resolving billing disputes ; issuing credit/debit notes 6. account reconciliation: specific responsibility for the area independent business unit (i.e. dha, ruh, jed), to ensure that all accounts maintained in this ledger are reconciled and reviewed with provincial credit control manager and kept up to date. 7. pricing: liase with query handler and sales regarding incorrect pricing within ibs, to advise sales administration to update ibs with the correct rates where incorrect rates have been noticed. 8. debt analysis: review aged debt analysis with each territory manager and sales to establish existing and potential bad debt exposure, making recommendations by customer to minimise bad debt exposure. distribution of >60 days aged debts ledger to sales and territory manager. 9. process optimization : improve order-to-cash process to ensure all invoices are accurately and submitted to customers in a timely manner ; support the business to analyse the order-to-cash process to reduce revenue leakages, risks and inefficiencies and so increase profitability and reduce customer complaints ; assess the impact of changes in business and system processes onto quality of order-to-cash process ; review and spread best practices ; develop countermeasures to address root causes of problems, risks and inefficiencies ; follow up and review results ; proactively identify new risks through regular process and system walk-throughs. 10. sales ledger maintenance: preparation of bad-debt write off form and accounts to move to legal in conjunction with the credit control manager, which should be sent to the customer accounting manager to submit to cfo for approval. 11. customer credit management: in conjunction with the area sales manager and the national sales manager co-ordinate and distribute credit suspension letter. prepare weekly credit suspension listing as per the national credit and receivables policy. 3. nature and scope a) context: maintaining dso as per the set targets. achieving monthly collection target. collecting old debts (60-120 days) reducing and maintaining aged debts in 30, 60, 90 and 120 days to the minimum. b) reporting relationships: the credit controller reports to the credit control manager. the credit control department consist of one credit control manager in each province and credit controllers based on mena segmentation threshold in located in all 3 province. c) contacts: the credit controller is frequently in contact with external customers by telephone, credit control manager and manager sales and other departments. there are regular ledger review meetings between the credit controllers and manager within the department, with customers, sales and couriers. d) problem solving: analyses difficult account problems to identify the causes and suggest solutions. interprets financial information accurately. e) decision making: effective collection method to be applied to certain customers. release of collection letters 1st reminder and final reminder based on guidelines on treatment plan after consulting with the sales department. suspension of credit facilities once otc policy is followed to be submitted to credit control manager approval, all mnc and key accounts must be reviewed and agree with sales manager before applying stop credit. potential write off to be submitted to ccm. f) planning and organisation: to plan and forecast the monthly collection target accurately. organise and monitor the territory to reduce and maintain dos to the minimum. g) job challenge: · collecting old debts (60-120 days and above) · customer visits as and when require. · solve sales and other problematic issues and ensure that the payment is made by the end f the month. 4. knowledge, skills and experience · degree or diploma in accountancy. knowledge in international billing system (ibs) and accounts receivable. computer literate – ms office. · organises tasks and time thoroughly. completes paperwork conscientiously. pays attention to detail. is methodical in approach to work. · negotiates assertively. can convince a wide range of people. is influential in meetings and on the telephone. gains commitment to suggestions. · produces easily understood, accurate written work. adapts style to suit a wide range of purposes. communicates clearly on a one-to-one or group basis. · analyses difficult account problems to identify the causes and suggest solutions. interprets financial information accurately. · maintains performance under pressure. reacts positively to changing demands and situations. is resilient. · at least two years dhl experience, to include familiarisation with the international billing system (ibs). accounts receivable knowledge. experience in handling sales ledgers, customer interface. 5. dimensions h) credit control team of one manager and 6 credit controllers in dammam, 5 in riyadh and 5 credit controllers in jeddah. 6. expected years of experience: 3-5 years relevant experience. 7. educational qualifications: a level (or equivalent). organisation chart signatures prepared by: name of job holder query handler verified by: name of job holder hr recruitment manager approved by: name of job holder chief financial officer signature: signature: signature: date: plans that support increased sales from targeted prospects. your profile: exhibits an exceptional degree of ingenuity, creativity, resourcefulness and empathy. analyzes and resolves complex agents for efficient customs clearance. coordinate with the finance team on bayan payments and support customs duty exemptions through the senaee platform, while managing customs audits, import/export metrics, and customs classifications (hs codes). act as the primary point of contact for all customs-related inquiries and issues, ensuring compliance and efficient handling of all customs operations. effective collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, alongside a proactive approach to identifying and addressing potential compliance issues and adapting to regulatory changes. demonstrated expertise in international and local trade laws, regulations, and standards, with proficiency in logistics and compliance software tools. what will put you ahead exposure to working with customs brokers, freight forwarders, and other logistics service providers. background in logistics or equivalent at koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. this means we openly challenge the status industries reduce emissions, save energy and get the most from their resources. from pollution control to advanced filtration, we're focused on providing customers with products and solutions to help them optimize, transform and succeed. industries we serve include refineries, chemicals, municipalities, pharmaceutical, pulp and paper, food and dairy, utilities and automotive. the equipment, description: : systra is one of the world's leading engineering and consultancy groups specialising in public transport and sustainable mobility. with over 10,300 employees, systra's mission is to design safe and sustainable transport solutions to bring people together, develop social inclusion and facilitate access to employment, education and leisure throughout the world. for 65 years, the group has been working alongside cities and regions to contribute to their development by creating, improving and modernising their infrastructure and transport systems, throughout the life cycle of their projects. systra is involved from the earliest stages of design through to the testing, deployment and maintenance phases. the company provides all its services in over 80 countries worldwide and generates 74% of its turnover internationally. with its new services, systra supports its clients and partners in their digital, ecological and energy transition, in order to invent the mobility of tomorrow. context: we are seeking a skilled and passionate sustainability and environmental engineer to join our team in saudi arabia. the ideal candidate will have expertise in sustainability practices and environmental compliance, strong communication skills, and experience managing certifications, submitting documentation, and ensuring compliance. this role also involves coordinating with project stakeholders, aligning engineering efforts with external partners, and ensuring successful project delivery and customer satisfaction. based on project requirements, the candidate may be located in urban or remote locations. missions/main duties: environmental and sustainability compliance ensure compliance with environmental regulations and sustainability standards across the project. conduct regular ems 14001 audits and inspections to verify adherence to sustainability and environmental policies and procedures. sustainability certification process lead the process for obtaining sustainability certifications (e.g., leed, mostadam, peer, envision, etc.). develop and manage documentation required for sustainability certification submissions. knowledge of embodied carbon management and lca. design review and compliance review project designs to ensure they meet environmental and sustainability criteria. provide feedback and recommendations to design teams to enhance sustainability performance. environmental and social impact assessment gap analysis conduct esia gap analyses to identify areas of non-compliance or improvement. develop action plans to address identified gaps and ensure compliance with esia requirements. environmental and sustainability deliverable review review and approve environmental and sustainability deliverables from contractors and consultants. ensure all deliverables meet project specifications and regulatory requirements. environmental compliance assurance monitor and enforce compliance with environmental laws, regulations, and project-specific requirements. implement corrective actions to address any non-compliance issues. facilitating environmental legal compliance ensure the project complies with all relevant environmental legislation and permits. liaise with legal teams to address any environmental legal issues that arise. stakeholder engagement engage with stakeholders to communicate environmental and sustainability goals and progress. address stakeholder concerns related to environmental and sustainability issues. reporting and documentation maintain accurate records of environmental and sustainability activities, audits, and inspections. prepare regular reports on environmental and sustainability performance for senior management. training and awareness develop and deliver training programs to enhance environmental and sustainability awareness among project staff. promote best practices in environmental management and sustainability. profile/skills: experience: 8-10 years in sustainability and environmental fields, with at least 5 years focused on implementing leed, envision, and other certification requirements at a project level. education: bachelor’s degree in environmental engineering or a closely related field with demonstrable experience in sustainability certifications. preferred professional accreditation: leed ga (preferably ap), mostadam ap, envision sp, and iso 14001 ems lead auditor. interpersonal and communication skills: strong ability to engage with diverse project teams and contractors. technical expertise: in-depth knowledge of sustainability certifications, environmental compliance assurance, and infrastructure design and construction phases. language proficiency: fluent in english and having a working knowledge of arabic is an added advantage. regulatory knowledge: familiar with saudi arabian green building codes, environmental regulations, international sustainability standards (leed & envision), and best practices. software skills: extremely proficient in ms office, aconex, and bim360, and proven expertise in statistical interpretation and presentation skills. data management skills: expertise and ability to manage and interpret large-scale environmental and sustainability data. : systra is an equal opportunities company; this position is open to all applicants.

name: Foodics
title: Head of Performance Marketing
description: who are we❓ we are foodics! a leading restaurant management ecosystem and payment tech provider. founded in 2014 with headquarter in riyadh and offices across 5 countries, including uae, egypt, jordan and kuwait. we are currently serving customers and partners in over 35 different countries worldwide. our innovative products have successfully processed over 6 billion (yes, billion with a b) orders so far! making foodics one of the most rapidly evolving saas companies to ever emerge from the mena region. also, foodics has achieved three rounds of funding, with the latest raising $170 million in the largest saas funding round in mena, boosting its innovation capabilities to better serve business owners. the job in a nutshell as we expand our presence, we are seeking a head of performance marketing who will drive strategic, data-driven marketing to optimize acquisition, retention, and engagement across digital and crm channels. will oversee two critical marketing functions: 1. digital marketing – managing all paid digital performance campaigns (google, meta, linkedin, etc.), seo, and web conversion optimization. 2. lifecycle & crm automation – ensuring best-in-class automated marketing workflows, segmentation strategies, and customer journey optimizations that enhance engagement and retention. this role is data-heavy and conversion-driven, requiring an analytical, hands-on leader who understands b2b saas marketing dynamics, lead generation, customer segmentation, and the impact of full-funnel marketing strategies in a high-growth tech company. what you will do develop and execute data-driven digital marketing strategies to optimize lead generation, customer acquisition, and engagement across multiple regions. manage and optimize multi-channel paid media campaigns (google ads, meta, linkedin, programmatic, etc.), ensuring high roas and cost-efficient cac. own the web conversion strategy, improving user journeys, landing page cro, and website seo to drive mqls and sqls. establish a/b testing frameworks, analyzing creatives, messaging, and targeting strategies to maximize ad effectiveness. lifecycle & crm automation lead the marketing automation and crm strategy, ensuring personalized lifecycle-driven marketing campaigns across email, push, whatsapp, and in-app notifications. develop audience segmentation strategies that enhance customer retention, upsells, and cross-sells within the foodics ecosystem. leverage data to orchestrate customer journeys, ensuring the right messages reach the right audience at the right time. align closely with the product, sales, and customer success teams to drive engagement and reduce churn. data, analytics, and attribution. own performance tracking and attribution modeling, ensuring accurate measurement of campaign success and customer journeys. work closely with bi and revenue ops to develop dashboards, insights, and reports that guide strategic decision-making. establish a test-and-learn culture, continuously experimenting with campaign structures, creative approaches, and audience targeting. manage and mentor a team of specialists across digital marketing and crm automation. work cross-functionally with sales, product, and growth teams to align marketing efforts with foodics’ business objectives. stay ahead of b2b saas and fintech marketing trends, integrating best practices into foodics’ strategies. what are we looking for❓ 8+ years of experience in performance marketing, with a strong b2b saas or fintech background. expertise in paid media buying, demand generation, and account-based marketing for lead-driven businesses. proven experience in crm marketing and marketing automation tools (hubspot, salesforce). strong analytical skills with hands-on experience in google analytics, google tag manager, looker, power bi. experience with seo, cro, and landing page optimization to improve conversion rates. deep understanding of customer lifecycle marketing, including segmentation, lead nurturing, and retention strategies. every decision should be backed by numbers and experimentation. agile, results-driven marketer who thrives in fast-paced environments. proactiveness – we need someone who takes initiative and gets things done. collaboration-first approach – marketing at foodics works together with sales, product, and customer success. who will excel❓ experience working in the f&b, fintech, or b2b saas sectors. understanding multi-touch attribution models and marketing impact measurement. strong leadership skills, managing and developing teams of specialists. experience in international, multi-market marketing strategies. what we offer you❗ we believe you will love working at foodics! we have an inclusive and diverse culture that encourages innovation and flexibility in-office, and hybrid work setups. we offer highly competitive compensation packages, including bonuses and the potential for shares. we prioritize personal development and offer regular training and an annual learning stipend to tackle new challenges and grow your career in a hyper-growth environment. join a talented team of over 30 nationalities working in 14 countries and gain valuable experience in an exciting industry. we offer autonomy, mentoring, and challenging goals that create incredible opportunities for both you and the company.

name: Arab Operators Trading EST
title: Dell Brocade SAN Director
description: *job description* we are seeking an experienced *brocade san director* to provide expert-level support for *storage area network (san) infrastructure*, with a focus on *brocade switches, dell emc storage, and data center networking*. this role requires hands-on expertise in *brocade fabric os (fos), san zoning, performance tuning, and troubleshooting* to ensure *high availability, security, and efficiency* of storage networking solutions in mission-critical environments. *responsibilities* * *perform regular health checks* on *brocade san switches*, including log analysis, firmware verification, and proactive issue identification. * *configure, manage, and troubleshoot san zoning*, port configurations, and inter-switch links (isls) to optimize storage connectivity. * *perform firmware upgrades* on brocade san switches, ensuring proper testing, rollback planning, and minimal downtime. * *troubleshoot complex san performance issues*, including latency, congestion, and path redundancy, using brocade network advisor (bna) and command-line diagnostics. * *replace and upgrade field replaceable units (frus) and customer replaceable units (crus)* on brocade switches and dell emc storage hardware. * *collaborate with storage and server teams* to ensure seamless san connectivity with dell emc storage systems such as powermax, unity, and powerscale. * *provide level 2/3 support* for escalations, working closely with *brocade (broadcom) tac and dell emc support* for complex issue resolution. * *maintain detailed inventory and documentation* of san hardware, software versions, and configurations. * *lead knowledge transfer sessions* for customers on best practices in san administration, troubleshooting, and security hardening. * *support data center migrations and expansions*, ensuring seamless integration of new brocade san switches and storage arrays. *qualifications (must-have)* ✅ minimum *5 years of hands-on experience* managing and supporting *brocade san switches in enterprise environments*. ✅ strong expertise in *brocade fabric os (fos), san zoning, wwn management, and multipathing configurations*. ✅ experience with *firmware upgrades, isl configurations, and high-availability san architectures*. ✅ deep knowledge of *dell emc storage systems (powermax, unity, powerscale, powerprotect, or vmax)*. ✅ experience working in *large-scale data centers, enterprise it environments, or financial sector infrastructure*. ✅ ability to work *on-site with emergency after-hours support* when required. *preferred qualifications* * *brocade certified san specialist (bcss) or brocade certified san designer (bcsd)* certification. * experience with *cisco mds san switches* (as an additional skill). * familiarity with *vmware storage integration, multipathing (mpio), and fc-nvme architectures*. * *comptia storage+ or equivalent san certification*. * prior experience as a *brocade san engineer, san administrator, or storage consultant*. job type: full-time

description: world wide generation is a sustainability fintech company operating across the uk, europe, singapore/asean, the uae and the kingdom of saudi arabia (ksa) markets. we also now have major partners across the world such as singapore stock exchange, kyndryl, world wide technology as well as the global telco etisalat (e&) to roll out making it the world's first and truly global sustainability data, finance and solutions exchange. world wide generation has also just secured a joint venture with major ksa conglomerate rawabi holding to streamline and standardise sustainability reporting across the region. the new venture will see rawabi and world wide generation fast track sustainability performance and financing especially in hard to abate sectors in saudi arabia and the wider middle east and north africa region. the g17eco platform offers an end to end sustainability as a service including sustainability education and advisory, digital reporting tools, a centre of excellence for digital transformation and performance improvement and a solutions and finance rewards marketplace. the mission of g17eco is to accelerate the financing and delivery of the sdgs by 2030- so our vision, mission and purpose is big! your skills, experience, and network can drive real impact in one of the greatest movements for change in human history. with our momentum in mena, this is a unique opportunity to scale up early successes, accelerate growth, and take the company to the next level—fast-tracking humanity and the planet toward purpose, protection, and prosperity. *role: * * as the business development executive for the middle east region, you will drive and help deliver the growth strategy within uae/ksa and the wider middle east region. it will involve building relationships and developing and closing business with mid, senior, and executive level sustainability and financial management in large corporations across multiple sectors. * you will report directly to our sales director and will be responsible for proactively developing sales with new customers to meet or exceed your sales targets. *responsibilities include, but are not limited to:* * to achieve the defined territory budget sales, for new customer acquisition, revenue, and margin targets. you will have your own sales quota. * create, execute, and maintain business development plans, highlighting projected revenue growth and opportunities; product/ service portfolios; and proposed actions/ timescales to meet revenue, margin, and business development objectives. * oversee and strengthen partnerships with e& and key strategic regional partners. * develop and execute account strategies, leading customer engagement across enterprise, public sector, and smb segments. * conduct in-depth market analysis to identify opportunities and implement growth strategies effectively. * position wwg as a leader in sustainability with an industry wide utility solution and global market infrastructure for public good, through customer and targeted sales prospecting initiatives. * engage with new prospects at senior management and operational level to increase new business and customer penetration across the wwg solutions portfolio. * take an active part in training, personal development, and other initiatives to achieve your individual knowledge, skill and sales objectives and the collective wider objectives of the company’s marketing and customer success strategies. * work closely with the wider business development team to develop robust strategic intelligence prior to meetings and conform to the company’s crm and other systems for information, reporting and control of sales operations. * feedback quickly and consistently, information on customer market, product, and competitor developments within individual and sector customer portfolios. * build efficient and supportive links with all colleagues and relevant departments of the company, to meet the wwg’s commitment to customer success as a shared priority. * support and execute the growth strategy for mena, driving business expansion and market positioning. * lead high-level customer engagement and strategic partnerships across enterprise, public sector, and smb segments, representing the company at senior levels. * build and strengthen relationships with key stakeholders, including government entities and industry leaders, to accelerate regional impact and growth. * managing the contract process for all clients. *qualifications and skills: * * a proven track record of selling saas (software as a service) and with sustainability and/or esg reporting knowledge/background. * arabic speaking preferable * proven track record of leading and developing account strategies for complex enterprise and public sector deals, including the ability to engage c-level executives and product specialists through compelling presentations and software demonstrations. * proven ability to achieve sales goals by positioning the company as a thought leader, shaping industry conversations, and positively influencing customers and key decision-makers at the highest levels. * ideally qualified to a bachelor’s degree or equivalent. * aptitude for digital systems and technology. * a passion for sustainability, impact, information management, technology, and product development. *evidence which demonstrates that the individual can: * * develop and execute a strategic growth plan for the market, identifying key opportunities and driving high-value enterprise deals. * lead complex negotiations with senior stakeholders across enterprise, public sector, and smb customers. * navigate ambiguity and evolving market conditions to position the company for success. * build and maintain executive-level relationships with customers, partners, and government entities. * manage and expand the partnership with e& and other strategic regional partners to accelerate business growth. *attributes:* * exceptional communication and influencing skills, with the ability to engage senior executives, government officials, and key decision-makers. * proven ability to build and sustain high-impact relationships with enterprise clients, strategic partners, and industry stakeholders. * strong strategic mindset with the ability to navigate complex negotiations and drive consensus in multicultural environments. * adept at managing ambiguity and thriving in fast-evolving, cross-functional settings. * legal authorisation to work full-time in the ksa/uae and will not require visa sponsorship now or in the future. *links*: website - linkedin - twitter - *equal opportunities * world wide generation is committed to applying its equal opportunities policy at all stages of recruitment and selection; and will always be carried out without discrimination for gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, colour, race, nationality, ethnic or national origins, religion, or belief, age, pregnancy or maternity leave or trade union membership. candidates with a disability will not be excluded unless it is clear that the candidate is unable to perform a duty that is intrinsic to the role, having taken into account reasonable adjustments, to ensure that no applicant is disadvantaged because of their disability. those conducting recruitment interviews will ensure that the questions they ask applicants are not in any way discriminatory or unnecessarily intrusive. the interview will focus on the needs of the job and skills required to perform it effectively. it is the policy of world wide generation that all employment decisions are based on principles of equal employment opportunity. job type: full-time application question(s): * are you legally authorized to work full-time in ksa/uae without requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future? * do you have experience selling saas (software as a service) solutions? if yes, please provide details, including the types of products and target industries. * do you have experience working with sustainability and/or esg reporting solutions? please elaborate. * how many years of experience do you have in business development or sales roles within the middle east region? education: * bachelor's (required) language: * arabic and english (preferred) application deadline: 11/04/2025

name: Islamic Development Bank
title: Lead Technical Cooperation Specialist
description: job purpose act as a technical authority on reverse linkage and technical cooperation internally for the isdb and externally for member countries. to lead the design and implementation of the bank's policy, strategy, operational plan, work programs and interventions relating to reverse linkage and technical cooperation, lead the inclusion of innovative solutions through reverse linkage in the member country partnership strategy (mcps), lead the effort to mobilise financial resources to supplement existing internal resources, advise global practices to mainstream reverse linkage within all activities of the bank and position isdb in the global landscape of south-south cooperation, sharing knowledge and expertise. key accountabilities policy and strategy planning and input: • advise on general strategic orientations related to reverse linkage and south-south cooperation and build the isdb's enabling environment for reverse linkage. • lead the formulation and updating of the isdb policies and strategies related to technical cooperation and reverse linkage. • ensure effective mainstreaming of reverse linkage in the isdb's sector policies, strategies and member country partnership strategy (mcps) and annual operational plans. • improve the technical cooperation mechanism of the isdb in line with the strategic orientations of the bank. • ensure that reverse linkage is well positioned within the corporate results framework, identify and select the relevant indicators based on the strategy objectives and report on them. • undertake the required capacity gaps analysis in the framework of the mcps in the assigned region. • contribute to the work plan, programs and activities and ensure timely achievement of the same. • undertake sector/analytical work and studies in relation to reverse linkage and capacity development to examine issues, assess the needs and identify required priority interventions, and prepare related policy briefs/notes. • collate inputs from global practices and regional hubs to prepare and regularly update bank's reverse linkage and capacity development approaches. • identify business process improvements and suggest changes to the quality team for the update of the operations manual. program and portfolio management: • provide overall leadership on cascading down the isdb's strategic plans and policies related to reverse linkage to the operational level. • assess the overall risk of the portfolio of reverse linkage and undertake required preventive/corrective measures. • lead the piloting of innovative approaches for operationalizing south-south and technical cooperation within and across regions as well as enable cross-regional knowledge fertilization and exchanges. • lead resource mobilization efforts to raise funds to supplement existing internal resources and support south-south and technical cooperation project and activities through the reverse linkage. • map the available development solutions in the regions and link them to the demand expressed by the member countries through reverse linkage. • conceptualize regional and cross regional reverse linkage programs and pilot new initiatives that encourage sharing expertise and best practices among member countries. • lead the peer-to-peer consultation process between the providers and recipients of expertise across the regions. • ensure high quality at entry of all reverse linkage and capacity development components and projects as well as technical cooperation operations. • ensure that changes made in the regions regarding new projects are compliant with reverse linkage policy and capacity development pillar strategy. • support the teams in regional hubs for timely and quality implementation of reverse linkage projects and technical cooperation operations. • collaborate with other teams to ensure dissemination of tailored knowledge and expertise to support project implementation. • ensure adequate consideration of cross-cutting issues, such as capacity development, women's empowerment and social/environmental issues in reverse linkage interventions. • undertake strategic interventions to build the national ecosystem of south-south and technical cooperation of the member countries across all regions. partnership: • promote the global agenda of south-south and technical cooperation. • position reverse linkage as effective mean for development assistance in the global architecture of south-south and triangular cooperation. • forge new partnerships with countries from the south for reverse linkage. • build, engage with and nurture diversified network of developers and strategic partners in the member countries and non-member countries in the regions for synergy, complementarities and co-financing of reverse linkage interventions in collaboration with the partnership development complex. • identify centers of excellence in the regions to partner with for reverse linkage interventions • promote connectivity among technical cooperation agencies from member countries and countries from the south as well as external development organizations and institutions, for the sake of mutual learning and benefits. knowledge sharing and dissemination: • guide, advice and coach team members in reverse linkage. • contribute to the transfer knowledge of division programs to other employees within isdb group and externally to member countries to ensure awareness. • increase stakeholders' awareness on isdb's initiatives, in particular, and best practices of south-south and technical cooperation in general. • develop knowledge product, papers and publications on south-south cooperation and reverse linkage. • keep abreast of international developments/advancements related to south-south and technical cooperation, with emphasis on the respective region. • contribute to building of necessary knowledge on reverse linkage within the regional hubs. reporting: • establish a mechanism to collect and analyze data on the mainstreaming of reverse linkage within the bank's operations. • prepare regular internal status reports of all activities of the division within the isdb group, highlight any concern areas and success stories on reverse linkage. • prepare report for external use to demonstrate and provide required information regarding reverse linkage projects in the regions. • coordinate with other sectors specialists to present the reports and publication related to performance of division's programs. • contribute to the establishment a robust feedback system for capturing information and lessons from various internal and external stakeholders on the operations of the division. academic and professional qualifications • minimum master's degree in finance, economics, business administration, international development or any other related field. • minimum 10 years of relevant experience in project and program design, advisory, projects monitoring and evaluation, technical cooperation, capacity development etc. ideally in similar type of multilateral organizations. • minimum 3 years of managerial / supervisory experience. skills & necessary knowledge • ms office • planning & organizing • expert in reverse linkage and south-south cooperation • sound knowledge in policy and strategy development • knowledge on development of tools and sector guidelines • advanced project management • drive for results • advanced analytical thinking • advanced problem solving • advanced partnership management • passion for excellence • teamwork

programs. join this team and you will help provide support to our clients from the earliest stages of analysis project evaluation to procurement, financial close, construction and operations. you will assist our clients in devising and comparing financial plans and delivery approaches for projects that involve public, federal or private financing; project revenues; and/or grants – and provide support to our clients in their implementation of those plans. the opportunity we’re looking for experienced, dynamic infrastructure advisory specialists to join our strategy and transactions team as part of our continued growth and success in the mena region. as part of our project finance team, you’ll develop your commercial capabilities working with our global networks and fast-moving, emerging clients. our diverse client portfolio will build your capabilities in pitching, briefing, managing relationships and challenging assumptions. in our friendly, collaborative environment, you’ll receive the support, formal training and coaching you need to progress quickly along the career path you choose. your key responsibilities as a professional within the project finance and infrastructure team you will be responsible for aassisting clients in the development and implementation of strategies to advance large-scale infrastructure and other projects. advise on the structuring and closing of financing for infrastructure projects and/or procurements, including the development, structuring, and negotiation of contract terms. you will be required to demonstrate a deep understanding of capital project/program funding, financing and delivery mechanisms at the local, state, and national levels to support analysis of client projects and provide project and program management assistance to clients and project teams on large projects. developing and mentoring junior team members will also be a key part of your role. skills and attributes for success individuals with a good knowledge of public-private partnerships (ppp), concessions and acquisition and project financing structures will do well in this role. project financing knowledge, with an understanding of project financial modelling and financing markets, would be highly valued and the understanding of economic or social infrastructure procurement and delivery to qualify for the role you must have a bachelor’s degree with at least 5 years of related work experience. experience with large-scale infrastructure projects with proven project management skills experience structuring infrastructure financing transactions and/or procurements and the commercial aspects of the associated documentation proven quantitative analytical capabilities; ability to build market-accepted financial models is preferred outstanding critical thinking skills with the ability to solve unstructured problems outstanding communication, writing and organizational skills intellectually curious with a strong desire to develop professionally in the infrastructure finance and policy sector ideally, you’ll also have experience in a top-tier advisory firm, infrastructure service provider, bank, relevant government agency or other relevant sector significant experience in a top-tier advisory firm, infrastructure service provider, bank, relevant government agency or other relevant sector professional qualifications such as cfa, frm, asia, cpa, ca and cma, will be considered an advantage. preferably a arabic speaker what we look for highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. an effective communicator, you’ll be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization. what we offer we offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. plus, we offer: continuous learning: you’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. success as defined by you: we’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. transformative leadership: we’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. diverse and inclusive culture: you’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. if you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. the exceptional ey experience. it’s yours to build. ey | building a better working world ey exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. enabled by data and technology, diverse ey teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax diabetes is managed. to unlock information and insights that drive better health outcomes. here we are 25 years later, having pioneered an industry. and we're just getting started. we are broadening provide the royal saudi naval forces (rsnf) planned maintenance interval (pmi) team with fully qualified quality control specialist that has a good working knowledge of the namp, and the 4790.2 will quality control and ground safety programs to ensure compliance with contract specifications and manage, monitor, and inspect aeronautical programs, and perform database entry with detailed knowledge procedures, equipment, and facilities. examines parts and components for conformance to design specification to determine serviceability; serviceable, unserviceable-repairable, unserviceable-non improvement program and reviews engineering investigative requests. initiates and reviews quality deficiency reports, technical deficiency reports and hazardous material reports to ensure completeness reporting, aircraft modification and configuration control and coordination of aircraft flight requirement with using activity. coordinate and direct activities between maintenance and supply sections maintenance procedures for the effective administration, supervision, and operation of the aircraft quality control activities. provide backup quality control inspection of the mh-60 series helicopters at the depot levels. perform all other position related duties as assigned or requested. minimum position qualifications, knowledge, skills, and abilities required: minimum of 6-8 years quality assurance and/or quality assurance representative (qar) experience. minimum of 10 years rotary wing experience. comnavairforinst 4790.2 (series) navairinst 3710.1 (series) navy aviation maintenance program (namp) iso as9100/as9110 registrations cdi, qar, cdqar navosh opnavinst 5100.19 must have knowledge of navy and depot level logistics support that includes repair and overhaul procedures for airframes, engines, and components. must have knowledge in supply, maintenance, quality control, production control, and safety. must have demonstrated communication skills, both oral and written. must be fluent in the english language.. must be capable of obtaining a valid light equipment operator’s license. must have a minimum of a high school diploma. preferences: navy mh-60 cdqar navy mh-60 series experience. ability to read, write, speak, and understand arabic is desirable. faa a&p with inspection authorization ia - desirable, not required. clearance requirement: must name: aramcoservices
title: Strategy and Energy Market Specialist
description: job req id: 15611 description: aramco energizes the world economy. aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. we are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer. with our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance aramco’s value to society. headquartered in the kingdom of saudi arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations’ spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the kingdom’s vast hydrocarbon resources. this responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply. we are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization. job purpose we are seeking an energy market specialist to join the policy and corporate finance strategy division (pcfsd) within saudi aramco’s treasury, located in dhahran, saudi arabia (hq). pcfsd performs strategic analysis including mid to long term liquidity forecasting as well as advisory on strategic treasury matters. pcfsd also serves as the primary interface for treasury with other business lines and affiliates within the company for strategic level corporate matters. your primary role is to contribute to the required various critical activities by analyzing energy market’s dynamics, conducting advanced scenario planning, and translating energy and economic trends into actionable corporate finance strategies. the role will also require collaboration with cross-functional teams to align financial strategies with internal and external market conditions, supporting the company’s broader treasury and financial objectives. key responsibilities as a successful candidate, you will have to perform the following: develop oil price forecasts across short, medium, and long-term horizons. provide regular analytical reporting on energy market trends, including regulatory changes, and geopolitical events impacting the markets assess the impact of changes in international energy standards and regulations on corporate reporting and strategic decision-making. interpret supply, demand, inventory levels, and global trade flows in oil and gas markets to identify trends and interdependencies. monitor and evaluate updates to international energy statistical methodologies and recommend improvements while maintaining measurement consistency. monitor global and regional policy changes, focusing on their impact on energy data collection, reporting, and compliance with international frameworks. collect, analyze, and interpret vast datasets from various sources (e.g., government reports, bloomberg, industry publications) to identify trends and patterns affecting corporate finance strategy. compare and evaluate company-generated energy data against data from international and national agencies, ensuring consistency and accuracy. conduct scenario planning and sensitivity analyses to evaluate financial and operational impacts due to changes in the energy market and to guide strategic decision-making, risk management, and cash flow planning utilize advanced tools like python, stata, matlab, and vba to build quantitative models (e.g., econometric modeling, time series analysis, monte carlo simulations) for price forecasting and scenario planning. understand, analyze and report on how the energy
