organizations and customers connected. sps have proven resilience as they quickly adapted to the sudden shifts in demand and will continue to be the backbone of emerging societies, markets, and industries. as we move forward, they will continue to evolve their strategies to meet shifting customer needs and expectations, providing secure, resilient, balanced, and reliably connected purpose-centric ecosystems. join us! be part of an incredible team where you can help build the bridge to possible. cisco seeks a solutions engineer to partner with our account managers in a pre-sales technical role, showcasing cisco product solutions-setting up demonstrations and explaining features and benefits to customers-and designing and configuring products to meet specific customer needs. solutions engineer at cisco is a key technical role to drive customer digital transformation. you will be a customer-focused technical sales professional who ensures that relevant technical information and guidance is provided to the customer, focusing on customer success and aligned outcomes. your impact gain access to the broad palette of cisco technologies and applications in the service provider market. direct account and partner responsibilities. stay abreast of relevant competitive solutions, products and services. provide technical and sales support for accounts in assigned territory. perform technical presentations for customers, partners and prospects. assist with the development of formal sales plans and proposals for assigned opportunities. lead pre-sale support including quote, network design, technical and financial proposal, pre-sale testing support etc. demonstrate technical solutions including cross-architectural solutions covering service provider routing, service provider mobility, cloud compute, data center routing and switching, security, automation and more. minimum qualifications thorough understanding of service provider network architecture. 5+ years of shown success in designing end to end large complex network to meet service providers requirements. in-depth knowledge of service providers transport technologies, architecture and protocols including mobile backhaul (4g/5g,), fttx/gpon, bng, x-haul (oran), metro, core and peering layers. ability to perform design, analysis and solutioning of transport sdn architecture for fixed & mobile converged network, comprises of core sp routing underlay (igp, bgp, mpls, sr-mpls, srv6), and overlay (l3/l2vpn, evpn, mvpn). in-depth knowledge and software skill set of network automation and orchestration, service provisioning and assurance. product knowledge in advance service provider routing and automation technologies either with cisco products or cisco competitor products. excellent written and verbal communication, listening, and strong presentation skills in english. ability to work effectively and add value as a team member. demonstrate technical knowledge and consultative skills to customer executives. strong problem-solving skills: ability to assess a problem and determine an effective course of action. can work under minimum supervision and under time pressure. self-motivated, fast learner and with proactive attitude. customer oriented strategic thinker, able to address customer concerns and to support customer business growth. bs/ba (electrical engineering/computer science) or equivalent from reputable university. preferred qualifications ccie r/s or ccie sp certifications or equivalent is preferred. presales experience working with telecom/service provider customers. strong understanding of adjacent technologies/architecture such as data center, security, enterprise networking. skilled in understanding the customers’ business drivers and aligning these to cisco solutions. negotiation skills to craft solutions that are beneficial to our customers and cisco. hands on experience in routing and switching products. capabilities to work with various non-technical groups (finance, legal, post sales). capabilities to lead a group of people with various technical backgrounds. fluency in arabic language. #wearecisco #wearecisco where every individual brings their unique skills and perspectives together to pursue our purpose of powering an inclusive future for all. our passion is connection—we celebrate our employees’ diverse set of backgrounds and focus on unlocking potential. cisconians often experience one company, many careers where learning and development are encouraged and supported at every stage. our technology, tools, and culture pioneered hybrid work trends, allowing all to not only give their best, but be their best. we understand our outstanding opportunity to bring communities together and at the heart of that is our people. one-third of cisconians collaborate in our 30 employee resource organizations, called inclusive communities, to connect, foster belonging, learn to be informed allies, and make a difference. dedicated paid time off to volunteer—80 hours each year—allows us to give back to causes we are passionate about, and nearly 86% do! our purpose, driven by our people, is what makes us the worldwide leader in technology that powers the internet. helping our customers reimagine their applications, secure their enterprise, transform their infrastructure, and meet their sustainability goals is what we do best. we ensure that every step we take is a step towards a more inclusive future for all. take your next step and be you, with us! message to applicants applying to work in the u.s. and/or canada: when available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in u.s. and/or canada locations, not including equity or benefits. for non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their u.s. or canada hiring location. the recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process. u.s. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday (for non-exempt employees), plus a day off for their birthday. non-exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. exempt new hires participate in cisco’s flexible vacation time off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use, but is subject to availability and some business limitations. all new hires are eligible for sick time off subject to cisco’s sick time off policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on january 1st of each year thereafter. up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. employees in illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. all employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. we offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. for quota-based incentive pay, cisco typically pays as follows: .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota; 1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%; 1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation. for non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, cisco may pay up to 125% of target. cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

and enable greater choice and flexibility to build, run, manage, connect and protect applications at scale. as a senior trittory manager, you will be responsible for driving revenue growth and maintaining customer satisfaction within assigned accounts. you will serve as the primary point of contact for clients, understanding their business needs, and aligning vmware solutions to address those needs effectively. key responsibilities: client relationship management: build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with key stakeholders within assigned accounts. understand client goals, challenges, and requirements, and proactively identify opportunities for vmware solutions. serve as a trusted advisor to clients, offering insights and recommendations to optimize their use of vmware products and services. sales and revenue generation: develop and execute strategic account plans to achieve sales targets and revenue goals. identify and pursue upselling and cross-selling opportunities within existing accounts. collaborate with internal sales teams and technical specialists to deliver comprehensive solutions that meet client needs. account planning and forecasting: conduct thorough account analysis to identify growth opportunities and potential risks. develop and maintain accurate account plans, including revenue forecasts and sales pipeline management. regularly review account performance against targets and take proactive measures to address any deviations. customer advocacy: act as the voice of the customer within vmware by broadcom, advocating for client needs and priorities. collaborate with internal teams to ensure timely resolution of customer issues and concerns. gather feedback from clients to inform product development and improvement initiatives. market and competitor analysis: stay informed about market trends, industry developments, and competitor activities related to virtualization and cloud technologies. use market insights to refine sales strategies and positioning of vmware solutions. what we expect from you: fluent in arabic and english track record of sales success working with commercial, small & medium and/or enterprise organizations experience with vendors associated with virtualization technology, cloud and saas is a plus track record of accomplishment selling to the it infrastructure specialists proven ability to develop new sales with end-users be a self-starter with the ability to learn quickly – highly coachable and open to learning be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where roles and responsibilities change quickly be comfortable traveling for at least 50% of the time qualifications: bachelor's degree in business administration, sales, marketing, or a related field (master's degree preferred). proven experience in sales or account management, preferably in the software or it industry. strong understanding of virtualization, cloud computing, and related technologies (experience with vmware products is a plus). excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills. ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities. results-oriented mindset with a track record of exceeding targets. benefits: competitive salary and benefits. opportunities for career advancement and professional development. a dynamic and collaborative work environment with a leading technology company. this job description outlines the key responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits associated with the role of account manager for vmware by broadcom. broadcom is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we will consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability status, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. we will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records consistent with local law. if you are located outside usa, please be sure to fill out a home address as this will be used for future correspondence.

name: Master-Works
title: Network Engineer
description: master-works is seeking a skilled network engineer to join our team and play a key role in designing, implementing, and maintaining our network infrastructure. in this position, you will collaborate with it and operations teams to ensure robust and scalable network solutions that support our business goals. you will be responsible for optimizing network performance, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring that our systems remain secure and efficient. key responsibilities: design, configure, and maintain network systems including routers, switches, firewalls, and vpns. monitor network performance and troubleshoot any issues to minimize downtime. implement security measures to safeguard the integrity and availability of network systems. collaborate with cross-functional teams to support integration with cloud services and on-premises environments. document network configurations, update network diagrams, and maintain records of network changes. stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to enhance network capabilities. provide technical support and training to team members as needed. by joining master-works, you will become part of a dedicated team that values innovation, collaboration, and personal growth while making a significant impact on our network infrastructure. requirements bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field. 3+ years of experience as a network engineer or in a similar role. strong knowledge of network protocols, such as tcp/ip, bgp, ospf, and vlans. experience with network monitoring tools and network management software. proficient in configuring and managing firewalls, switches, and routers. understanding of network security principles and practices. relevant industry certifications (e.g., ccna, ccnp, comptia network+) are preferred. excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills. strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively.

description: pre-sales engineer - fire & life safety - saudi arabia / al-khobar siemens strongly believes in the value of a digital portfolio, hence smart infrastructure combines digital power distribution and digital building infrastructure technologies. our digital portfolio will enable our customers to enjoy occupant’s intuitive buildings which are comfortable, safe, secure and energy efficient. smart infrastructure from siemens intelligently connects energy systems, buildings and industries to adapt and evolve the way we live and work. we work together with customers and partners to build an ecosystem that intuitively responds to the needs of people and helps customers to better use resources. it helps our customers to thrive, communities to progress and supports sustainable development. join our smart infrastructure buildings (si b) team as pre-sales engineer - fire & life safety and help us re-imagine the world by finding solutions and making the world a smarter place for tomorrow. your role – international, challenging and future-oriented! reporting to the head of bid & proposal management (bpm), you will be part of the centralized team and responsible for, but not limited to, the following: analyze tender requirements, assess customer needs, and define the most suitable siemens fire & safety products, architecture, and systems. configure, size, and estimate costs for fire & life safety systems, including fire detection & alarm, aspirated smoke detection, smoke control/management, voice evacuation, fire telephone, and fire suppression (fk-5-1-12, inert gas). prepare and submit technical and commercial offers, ensuring compliance with siemens' bid approval process and risk evaluation guidelines. act as a subject-matter expert, leading technical discussions with customers and consultants. collaborate with the sales team to optimize bid success and improve order conversion rates. provide pre-sales and technical support across all regions in saudi arabia, including travel as needed. clarify and resolve technical concerns by coordinating with regional technical support and factory representatives. ensure a seamless project handover to execution teams. develop technical standards and procedures while proposing improvements for fire & safety solutions. maintain data accuracy, track proposal quality, and ensure compliance with all submission requirements. promote siemens fire products and solutions. your qualifications and skills – digital and solid! bachelor’s degree in electrical or electronics engineering. 5–10 years of experience in the fire & life safety industry. extensive knowledge of nfpa, bs, ibc standards, and local fire safety codes, including the saudi fire code and hcis saf guidelines. familiarity with client-specific standards from saudi aramco, sec, sabic, marriott, and others. proven expertise in designing and estimating medium to large-scale fire safety projects, including fire detection & alarm, aspirated smoke detection, smoke control/management, voice evacuation, fire telephone, fire suppression (fk-5-1-12, inert gas) etc. strong grasp of ip networking in fire safety systems, including network security considerations. knowledge of cloud-based solutions, apis, and edge gateways. familiarity with siemens’ ul & en fire portfolio is an advantage. extensive experience in estimating complex fire safety systems for industrial projects such as refineries, power plants, substations, and gas plants. self-driven professional with a strong ability to adapt to emerging technologies and new products. excellent command of english, both spoken and written, including proposal writing. proficiency in arabic is a plus. strong public speaking, presentation, and documentation skills. exceptional stakeholder management, capable of leading cross-functional teams and technical discussions across global regions. team-oriented, thriving in dynamic work environments. familiarity with bentley microstation, autocad, and clean agent system flow calculation software. what else do you need to know? as a world leader in developing and producing the most advanced engineering technologies, we improve lives and further human achievements worldwide, while also protecting the climate - all thanks to our employees. working with us, you have the foundation to develop personally and professionally. we give you the chance to do something significant, that benefits society and human progress. we give you the chance to create a difference. diversity at siemens is our source of creativity and innovation. having different types of talent and experiences makes us more ambitious and better prepared to respond successfully to the demands of the society. therefore, we value the candidates that reflect the diversity that we enjoy in our company. please find more information at www.siemens.com at siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. we need the most innovative and diverse digital minds to develop tomorrow‘s reality. find out more about the digital world of siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds we are looking forward to receiving your online application. please note: only complete applications can be considered in the selection process.

develop knowledge of industry trends and understand how cisco solutions provide financial and strategic value. build relationships within and outside of cisco, establishing credibility through self-confidence. understand customer business models and financial pain points, framing cisco offerings around business drivers. comprehend cisco’s vision and technology and articulate it from the customer's perspective. map customer business drivers to their network platform. minimum qualifications 9+ years of related experience. cisco product experience or relevant experience in key competitor offerings in the technology area of emphasis. pre-sales experience. typically requires a bs/ba (ee/cs) or equivalent. ccie certification preferred. the candidate must be based in ksa. ksa experience is required preferred qualifications expertise in internetworking industry trends, including sd-wan, aci, dna, security sase, ai, cloud, digital transformation, automation, and more. experience with ai, machine learning, cloud native applications, kubernetes, and docker. knowledge of ml ops, ai ops, and ci/cd pipelines. understanding of competitive product and solution landscapes. advanced knowledge in routing & switching, data center, and security. strong technical consulting skills, including defining trade-offs, asking probing questions, and integrating cisco solutions into broader environments. ability to share replicable architectures tailored to customers' needs. programming skills are a plus. in-depth knowledge of your specialization and adjacent technologies, including product, technology, and competitive insights. excellent written and verbal communication skills. strong presentation skills, delivering clear explanations of cisco's architectures, business outcomes, and values. we are cisco #wearecisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. here’s how we do it. we embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. and a security company. an ai/machine learning company. we even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. no other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box! but “digital transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.) day to day, we focus on the give and take. we give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our dna.) we take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward. so, you have colorful hair? don’t care. tattoos? show off your ink. like polka dots? that’s cool. message to applicants applying to work in the u.s. and/or canada: when available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in u.s. and/or canada locations, not including equity or benefits. for non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their u.s. or canada hiring location. the recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process. u.s. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday (for non-exempt employees), plus a day off for their birthday. non-exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. exempt new hires participate in cisco’s flexible vacation time off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use, but is subject to availability and some business limitations. all new hires are eligible for sick time off subject to cisco’s sick time off policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on january 1st of each year thereafter. up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. employees in illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. all employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. we offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. for quota-based incentive pay, cisco typically pays as follows: .75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota; 1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%; 1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation. for non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, cisco may pay up to 125% of target. cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

name: SAS
title: Senior Account Executive – Energy & Utilities
description: : senior account executive – energy & utilities (saudi national required) nice to meet you! we’re a leader in data and ai. through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence - and questions into answers. we’re also a debt-free multi-billion-dollar organization on our path to ipo-readiness. if you're looking for a dynamic, fulfilling career coupled with flexibility and world-class employee experience, you'll find it here. senior account executive – energy & utilities (saudi national required) about the job we’re looking for a senior account executive (energy & utilities) who has software sales and account management experience within the saudi and wider meta region. you will be responsible for sales of sas software products, solutions and services in a high volume, multi-tasking environment to prospective and current accounts with a focus on the energy & utilities sector. you will: sell software, solutions and services to current and prospective customers; works with other sales/pre-sales/domain/personnel to position and leverage sales opportunities to acquire, grow and retain customers within assigned territory. fulfil a wide range of requests for information from prospective customers. qualifies level of opportunity and resources required. prospect within accounts to uncover business needs and drive new business opportunities. implement territory and account management and development; identifying accounts with high "close" potential, qualifying, advancing opportunity through milestone steps of sales cycle and forecast time frames to close business. work closely with pre-sales resources and executives to facilitate timely response to highly qualified, high revenue potential opportunities. prepare standard quotations and proposal information as needed; works with other departments to create and finalize contracts and set time schedules for delivery services. follow up with customers to track satisfaction levels and to discover additional revenue opportunities. develop an understanding of company pricing, licensing procedures and approvals matrix. fully utilize account planning process and tools what we’re looking for knowledge of advanced strategic sales techniques; knowledge of hardware and/or software acquisition cycles and buying influences. knowledge of saas complex solution sales ideally data analytics and ai. awareness of sas solutions and services preferred. experience with saudi and meta region energy & utilities industry. excellent written and verbal communication skills, strategic selling skills, skills in analyzing and evaluating territory dynamics to develop and implement a sales plan. ability to initiate and lead projects; ability to work effectively in a team environment; ability to relate technical and business concepts to sas applications and user needs; ability to work independently and as part of a team; ability to travel on a frequent basis. excellent english and arabic speaking – saudi national required. you’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. these are our values and influence everything we do. please note: this position is open exclusively to candidates of saudi nationality in compliance with saudization (nitaqat) regulations and local labor laws. we are committed to adhering to national employment policies and fostering opportunities for local talent. all applications will be evaluated fairly based on the qualifications and requirements of the role. diverse and inclusive at sas, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. we believe our people make the difference. our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. to put it plainly: you are welcome here. additional information: sas only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. if you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, or on behalf of sas, please contact recruitingsupport@sas.com. #sas #li-sb2 #li-hybrid

engagement with the retailers, implementing the hyke programs, improving the product catalogue relevant to the zone, growing the retailer base and providing recommendations to increase the support management § resolve the queries within the stipulated time arising on usage, ordering, support on new features, refreshers for new staff etc. 5. job context: to implement and execute the account management and support team in mobile industry uae, minimum 3 years § good communication and persuasion skills with ability to establish excellent working relationship § leadership trait that will enable the internal growth , good interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team § good knowledge on uae trade behaviour § self motivated individual 9. competencies: behavioural competencies drive for results analysing & interpreting adaptability / flexibility technical competencies grade 9 – 13 inc population 3 supervisory to jnr management pda knowledge (basic) computer proficiency (ms office) driver’s license telecom knowledge (basic) negotiation skills building customer relationships market intelligence route planning numeric ability knowledge of trade

name: NTT DATA
title: Manager, Environmental Health and Safety
description: make an impact with ntt data join a company that is pushing the boundaries of what is possible. we are renowned for our technical excellence and leading innovations, and for making a difference to our clients and society. our workplace embraces diversity and inclusion – it’s a place where you can grow, belong and thrive. your day at ntt data the manager, environmental health and safety (ehs) is a seasoned management role, responsible for ensuring the implementation and management of ehs programs and policies within the organization. this role ensures compliance with relevant regulatory requirements, standards, and best practices, and fosters a culture of safety and environmental stewardship among employees and business stakeholders. this role provides guidance, support, and coaching to the ehs team and other cross functional teams on ehs matters and fosters a collaborative and innovative team culture focused on achieving operational excellence. what you'll be doing key responsibilities: ensures the implementation and monitoring of ehs strategy, objectives, and action plans. ensures compliance with applicable ehs laws, regulations, and standards, and maintain relevant documentation and records. conducts regular audits, inspections, and risk assessments to identify and eliminate hazards, and implement corrective and preventive actions. manages and reports on the ehs performance indicators, metrics, and trends, and provide recommendations for improvement. provides ehs training, awareness, and communication to employees and stakeholders, and promotes a positive ehs culture. investigates and responds to ehs incidents, accidents, and emergencies, and ensures proper reporting and follow-up. oversees the procurement and maintenance of ehs equipment and supplies. manages, mentors, and evaluates the ehs team, and ensures their professional development and performance. collaborates and coordinates with internal and external parties on ehs issues and projects. stay updated on the latest ehs trends, best practices, and innovations, and implements them as appropriate. knowledge, skills and attributes: advanced knowledge of ehs laws, regulations, and standards, and ability to interpret and apply them. skills in ehs auditing, risk assessment, incident investigation, and problem-solving. proficiency in ehs management systems, tools, and software, such as iso 14001, ohsas 18001, or ehs dashboard. excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, and ability to work with diverse teams and stakeholders. ability to lead and manage a team. strong organizational, and project management skills, and ability to work independently and under pressure. high level of integrity, ethics, and professionalism, and commitment to ehs excellence. ability to deal with conflict situations. academic qualifications and certifications: relevant bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification in a related field and/or equivalent experience. relevant health, safety and environmental certification(s) essential. required experience: advanced active working experience with environment, health and safety issues in a related industry / environment. advanced experience dealing with a variety of stakeholders and influencing decision making to manage business risk. advanced experience dealing with legislators and governing bodies. advanced knowledge of the ehs laws, regulations, codes, and standards and their application and interpretation. seasoned experience leading and managing environment, health and safety team(s)/function. workplace type: on-site working about ntt data ntt data is a $30+ billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. we serve 75% of the fortune global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. we invest over $3.6 billion each year in r&d to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. as a global top employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure, and connectivity. we are also one of the leading providers of digital and ai infrastructure in the world. ntt data is part of ntt group and headquartered in tokyo. equal opportunity employer ntt data is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. we are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. we do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, gender, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, disability, pregnancy, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected category. join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. apply today.

name: Air Products
title: Plant Process Engineer
description: at air products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world. reimagine what’s possible position summary this position will provide technical support to ongoing plant operations, projects from development to start up, and will lead asset management/productivity initiatives for all the bhig facilities in the region through the coordination of the activities from the process/production engineers & operations teams stationed at plants. the position may also support other air products / bhig operations teams in providing similar services to air products joint ventures, sale of equipment and potential new customers in the region. the primary focus for this position will be hyco ( steam methane reformer) technology, however may include other technologies based on the candidates expertise. job incumbent is to be located in our ksa daharan technology center or the jubail offices/site, however is expected that about 30-40% regional [and some global] travel will be required. nature & scope the plant process engineer, reporting to the bhig engineering supervisor, provides day to day operation & technical support to the regional sites through daily monitoring to ensure production and efficiency targets are being achieved safely. the role identifies productivity ideas, develops projects and supports the project execution team for the facilities in the region. the facilities range across multiple technologies such as air separation (asu), hydrogen (hyco), and co2 production. the role may support other air products / bhig plant support teams in providing similar services to our joint venture partners, sale of equipment and new customers. this position interfaces with air products global, regional, and local process/production engineers, regional operations team members, project and design engineering teams, safety and other technical support personnel in the execution of the responsibilities of this position. the position will help implement the necessary systems and measures to support bhig’s middle east operations requirements, technical standards, quality processes, and plant and equipment maintenance. the incumbent will work to coordinate and utilize in the most effective manner the available operating and technical resources available globally to support the existing operations as well as new installations or modifications led by bhig project engineering or the air products global engineering & manufacturing organization. the position will help drive consistency in air products global operations within bhig across all countries in the middle east region. the incumbent will help drive improvement of the operations productivity, reliability, quality, process safety, and cost effectiveness of the plants the region. bhig’s systems, tools and methods (ex. continuous improvement techniques) will be used where feasible in order to achieve performance results and global consistency. this position will be responsible for leading the asset management activities within the plants in the middle east region to achieve annual productivity gains and help to ensure ideas are effectively transferred to the other applicable operations within bhig’s organization in the region. developing and keeping track of plant performance and reliability kpi will be a part of the position. principal duties and responsbilities safety maintain a safe work environment. demonstrate leadership with all company & industry safe work processes to prevent all injuries. ensure proper documentation is maintained for safety related activities. ensure proper process safety work practices are understood and are being used in the plants. technical: lead and provide technical support services in the new installation, existing plant modifications, on-going operations, and continuous improvement and maintenance activities for the facilities in the region. ensure the activities related meet legal requirements and comply with bhig’s safety and technical standards. provide technical support to other support teams in region for new installations, existing plant modifications, on-going operations, and continuous improvement and maintenance activities for air products joint ventures, sale of equipment and potential new customers in the region. the support will be provided by either onsite visits, phone support, or from the process intelligence center via mentored monitoring capabilities. provide technical support and safety leadership for moc’s, ophr’s, and other safety related initiatives in order to drive process safety compliance. consult bhig and air products process safety personnel as required for additional technical support. provide technical support to ensure the safe and reliable operation of equipment, processes, utilities, and controls is achieved. provide process engineering leadership to drive asset performance, reducing operating costs or increasing plant throughput, by supporting the following efforts: troubleshooting, plant efficiency, process safety, equipment reliability, advanced controls, asset management and productivity project identification, development, and execution support. facilitate attainment of operations excellence via continuous improvement in plant productivity, reliability, quality, and cost reduction. lead ongoing improvements and ensure best practices are implemented using tools such ci techniques and asset management initiatives. provide technical leadership in supporting/leading investigations and root cause analysis in order to identify & implement sustainable corrective actions. provide technical support for advanced controls initiatives monitor plant production daily, driving asset performance & ensuring daily targets are met to achieve maximum profitable. operations ensure the safety of all operations personnel by utilizing the bhig basic safety practice program, which includes safety work permits, loto, confined space, etc. the position provides technical support for executing, organizing, and auditing the safety systems, to build the bhig safety culture into the meet organization. provide process engineering support to operations in order to effectively operate the smr (steam methane reformer) primarily, and may assist with the asu, and co2 facilities in region to meet the customer’s satisfaction on safety, reliability, product quality, and flexibility of product supply while in compliance of contractual requirements. insure bhig’s standards, air products global best practices for eh&s, productivity, reliability, quality, and overall customer services are met ensure the middle east facilities are operated not to exceed environmental and regulatory requirements. provide technical guidance, working with the commissioning team, assisting in the commissioning, startup, and troubleshooting activities. participate in the training of the operations team up to plant commissioning assist operations in maintaining accurate document control and monitor quality assurance initiatives. participate in developing the month end close model and ensure alignment with commercial obligations for the bhig middle east commercial area. support & maintain close working relationships with engineering and maintenance personnel to continuously monitor & evaluate plant systems & equipment through a plant process advisory model. support the process intelligence center (pic) initiatives as required such as: plant monitoring & troubleshooting, plant simulation training sessions, plant modeling initiatives, and plant efficiency monitoring where applicable. maintain alignment with the operations plant managers, site leadership and the business area to align with asset management opportunities and commercial priorities provide technical support for turnarounds. job requirements bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering with 8 + years’ experience in engineering and/ or operations in a technical role experience and knowledge in the technology, design, and operation of steam methane reformers (hyco) required. knowledge in air separation and co2 production systems a plus. individual technology skillsets will be entertained, however multiple technology skillsets preferred. start-up, commissioning or plant operating experience an advantage experience with aspen software and associated modules a plus. demonstrated engineering and technical capabilities & skills. knowledgeable in process safety, health, and local environmental requirements. a strong commitment to employee involvement, team building and diversity. able to communicate between management, operations, maintenance, and customers within and across regions. proficiency in english speaking and writing, arabic language skills is a plus. demonstrated leadership, organizational, computer and interpersonal skills combined with good communications skills (written and verbal) in english a must. a personal commitment to continuous self-development and flexibility to work outside normal working hours to meet commitments. excellent influencing skills are a major requirement for the job holder. possess critical thinking skills and has the ability to build trust and confidence with frontline workers, supervisors and management. strong problem solving and analytical skills are a pre-requisite confident and assertive with self-motivated approach and influence attitude. a personal commitment to corporate values & objectives and towards a culture of continuous improvement. formal training and experience with six sigma processes and continuous improvement tools a plus. working conditions the work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. disclaimer the above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. they are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. quality quality encompasses all aspects of bhig’s business, and every employee shares the responsibility to prevent the occurrence of any nonconformity relating to product, process and the quality system. all employees have an obligation to identify and record any such nonconformity, and through designed channels, initiate and recommend solutions. we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. we are hydrogen and industrial gas experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future. at air products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. to learn more, visit about air products.

name: PwC
title: Account Driver
description: line of service internal firm services industry/sector not applicable specialism ifs - clients & markets management level manager job description & summary pwc global overview at pwc, we measure success by our ability to create the value that our clients and our people are looking for. our reputation lies in building lasting relationships with our clients and a focus on delivering value in all we do. we’re a network of firms in 152 countries with more than 328,000 people who are committed to delivering world-class capabilities and quality in assurance, tax and advisory services. pwc middle east overview established in the region for over 40 years, pwc middle east employs around 7,500 people across 12 countries: bahrain, egypt, iraq, jordan, kuwait, lebanon, libya, oman, qatar, saudi arabia, palestine and the united arab emirates. complementing our depth of industry expertise and breadth of skills is our sound knowledge of local business environments across the middle east region. our tailored solutions help our clients meet the challenges and opportunities of doing business in the middle east market, and beyond. line of service overview internal firm services (ifs), is a network of specialist support professionals and includes clients & markets (pursuit & proposals, business & client development, inbounds, industries and markets & insights), recruitment, marketing & communications, human capital, finance, technology, learning and development and procurement, to name but a few. each team plays a vital role in making sure we have all the right resources, services and technology across our business. as an account driver, you will support the largest accounts for pwc in the me region. this will involve working with the account’s global relationship partner, engagement partners active on the account, as well as their teams from across our different lines of service. the role combines two priorities functioning as a strategic advisor on the account by building a powerful organizational memory of our clients as well as related insights. playing a key operational role to drive best practice in the account’s management. an account driver is a person who brings strong networking & relationship building skills (both internally and externally), as well as comes from a strong account management background. prior experience in a big4, strategy house, or large multinational company is not necessary, but is a plus. they are responsible for driving best practice in their accounts, and so will have to bring an inclusive mindset as well as the technical skills and dedication needed to succeed. at pwc we are an equal opportunity employer and as part of our commitment to both our regional sustainability strategy and to remain compliant with relevant local labour laws, some of our roles will be dedicated for national talent only - looking for ksa nationals only. key responsibilities: driving the annual account planning process establishing a regular account rhythm, including touchpoints between the teams helping the firm capture, analyze, and redistribute knowledge and intelligence driving the full pursuit lifecycle, from the moment an rfp is released all the way to it’s post-decision analysis building strategic relationships with key departments at the client (for example procurement, finance, compliance, etc) manage internal & external stakeholders, build the needed knowledge about the firm, services and offerings. drive xlos engagement. understand key trends across the industry across the middle east markets and use insights to anticipate new business opportunities manage team members and projects across accounts requirements: the candidate will be a highly motivated and a high performing individual with the ability to be flexible and adaptive on a daily basis education: bachelor's degree or equivalent years of experience: 4-6 years in an account management or bd role - preferably within a professional services environment strong project management skills and experience managing team members. fluency in spoken and written english and arabic is preferred (with some exceptions) previous experience in strategy consulting or management consulting is a plus strong capability in excel/google sheets and powerpoint/google slides skills, as well as more generally, being proficient in microsoft office and g-suite knowledge and skills: strong problem solving and analytical skills excellent communication (verbal and written) skills excellent organizational, time management, quality management, and project management skills with the ability to prioritize workload, work with senior stakeholders and perform under pressure knowledge of the professional services industry is a plus proficiency in salesforce is an advantage proficiency in powerbi is an advantage education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified) degrees/field of study required: degrees/field of study preferred: certifications (if blank, certifications not specified) required skills optional skills accepting feedback, accepting feedback, active listening, analytical thinking, business case development, business development, business expansion, business partnering, business presentations, business requirements analysis, client management, client prospecting, coaching and feedback, communication, compensation strategy, contract negotiation, creativity, crm software, customer acquisition, digital business development, distribution channel performance, embracing change, emotional regulation, empathy, executive negotiation {+ 35 more} desired languages (if blank, desired languages not specified) travel requirements up to 20% available for work visa sponsorship? no government clearance required? no

name: Air Products
title: Instrument and Controls Engineer
description: at air products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world. reimagine what’s possible position summary purpose the i&c engineer will work closely with the site maintenance team, operations, technical management and responsible for coordinating, organizing, and executing instrumentation & controls activities for preventative and corrective maintenance, with the aim of reducing maintenance related costs while improving plant reliability and availability, in line with business needs for facilities which range across multiple technologies such as air separation (asu), steam methane reformer (hyco), co2 capture and utilities, along with ancillary equipment to support the facility. the role supports the o&m team in providing similar services to our joint venture partners, sale of equipment and new customers as required for apq jubail, saudi arabia. nature & scope the i&c engineer, reporting to the lead controls engineer / engineering supervisor is responsible for providing day-to-day support, maintaining safe, reliable, and efficient operation of the instrument & controls systems in the facility as well as executing preventative and corrective maintenance activities for all site low voltage instrument & controls equipment as cascaded by maintenance management and engineering. the position will work closely with internal and external resources and ensure the scope of work is executed in a safely and reliably. the facilities range across multiple technologies such as air separation (asu), hydrogen and co2 production (hyco) and h2 mobility. as a member of the o&m team, the i&c engineer will interact routinely with plant operations, maintenance, and instruments technicians to execute troubleshooting support, instructions, and technical guidance related to the site’s instrumentation & controls systems. the position emphasizes teamwork, communications, organization, change management, work process optimization, planning, leadership, and hands-on technical skills with comprehensive knowledge across disciplines. principal accountabilities safety maintain a safe work environment. demonstrate leadership with all company & industry safe work processes to prevent all injuries. insure proper documentation is maintained for safety related activities. technical provide technical solution, lead execution plan of sap pm activities for all aspects of plants instrumentations, analysers, gas chromatography, and process controls systems including dcs, local plc’s, and related control loops. maintain responsibility for the long-term instrumentation & controls planning and support with respect to calibrations, spare parts management, controls logic, programming, graphics changes, operational changes, systems migration & back up. perform safety integrity level (sil) assessments and verification. provide engineering support & prepare punch list during the construction & commissioning of the plants & ensure close out of punch items timely. maintain accurate document control and monitor quality assurance initiatives. interface with process engineering to: identify gaps & scope of improvements in operating and control strategies to achieve productivity targets. develop tracking programs and metrics for plant optimization and efficiency, and controller on-stream. monitor the targets against expected performance. areas of emphasis include manufacturing cost reduction, waste handling and reduction, raw materials, utilities consumption/cost/supply, production process reliability and capacity expansions. interface with the advanced controls to define appropriate dcs interface requirements, and jointly design, implement and test those interfaces. contribution in support of plant productivity or improvement projects, including specification of instruments, configuration of control systems, detailed cable and wiring design, provision of work packages for contractors to bid and installations. ensure availability & record of most updated detailed engineering specifications (including sizing calculations) for the procurement of instrument & controls systems components and equipment (control valves, flow meters, inline devices, transmitters, analyzer, etc.). provide engineering input for development and maintenance of instrument & controls systems & equipment standards, procedures, best practices, inspection contracts, and contractor selection guidelines. lead and provide technical support services in the new installation, existing plant modifications, on-going operations, and continuous improvement and maintenance activities for the facilities in the region. insure the activities related meet legal requirements and comply with air products qudra safety and technical standards. provide technical sales support to the equipment sales & product services team for new installations, existing plant modifications, on-going operations, and continuous improvement and maintenance activities for air products qudra, sale of equipment and potential new customers in the region. the support will be provided by either onsite visits, phone support, or from the process intelligence centre via mentored monitoring capabilities. provide technical support and safety leadership for moc’s, ophr’s, and other safety related initiatives in order to drive process safety compliance. consult air products qudra process safety personnel as required for additional technical support. provide technical leadership in supporting/leading investigations and root cause analysis in order to identify & implement sustainable corrective actions. operations insure the safety of all operations personnel by utilizing the air products qudra basic safety practice program, which includes safety work permits, loto, confined space, etc. the position provides technical support for executing, organizing, and auditing the safety systems, to build the air products qudra safety culture into the organization. provide instrument and controls engineering support to operations in order to effectively operate the asu, hyco, co2 and h2 mobility facilities in region to meet the customer’s satisfaction on safety, reliability, product quality, and flexibility of product supply while in compliance of contractual requirements. ensure air products qudra standards, best practices for eh&s, productivity, reliability, quality, and overall customer services are met. provide technical support, working with the commissioning team, assisting in the commissioning, start-up, and troubleshooting activities. participate in the training of the operations team up to plant commissioning. assist operations in maintaining accurate document control and monitor quality assurance initiatives. maintain alignment with the operations plant managers, site leadership and the business area to align with asset management opportunities and commercial priorities provide technical support for turnarounds. implement and maintain compliance with all critical safety circuits (css), safety integrity levels (sil), and safety instrumented systems (sis) implementation and revalidation programs. establish & maintain a relationship with the local inspection bureau, maintain relevant statutory, regulatory, technology standards, and code information consistent with jubail ig hub plant operational objectives. establish & maintain compliance with all company and local regulations. this position is also responsible for helping to implement critical safety systems (css) revalidation work, moc and spare parts strategy in the plant. participating in technical reviews, equipment design, installation, operation, and optimizations (productivity) of equipment & systems including validations, mechanical integrity, and management of change along with procedures development & implementations. repair & maintenance establish & maintain close working relationships with plant process engineering & operations personnel to continuously monitor & evaluate plant performance & process controls systems & equipment. develop and implement a comprehensive process controls systems & equipment maintenance plan and provide appropriate technical guidance and detailed instructions to schedule, execute, and monitor compliance of plans. provide guidance to help develop and implement engineering solutions to repetitive failures and other conditions which adversely impact plant operations. provide engineering support and participate / lead incident investigations and root cause analysis. identify & implement sustainable corrective action(s). provide engineering guidance to the maintenance team in setting spare parts inventory levels, manage quality, and provide input to inventory strategies. project management/budget employ appropriate project development and project management activities (including scope, budget, schedule, execution strategies, risk plans, cost collection / reporting, etc.) for the execution of all projects and turnaround activities. provide engineering support to develop the annual budget for process controls systems & equipment maintenance, repair, and system upgrades. professional lead by example to promote an atmosphere of team spirit through good example, open communication, good listening, and timely problem resolutions. drive continuous improvement in safety performance, reliability, and cost of quality goals. foster and support positive working relationships with internal and external customers. support, mentor and develop local instrument technicians. minimum requirements and qualifications engineering graduate with >10 years of related process automation experience in chemical / refinery / gas plant maintenance / inspection / engineering. troubleshooting’s & maintenance level knowledge of siemens pcs7 distributed control system (dcs), specifications, and configuration, with additional emphasis on programming proficiency with siemens pcs7, step7, wincc. additional experience with other controls platforms a plus. demonstrated “hands-on” ability to configure, calibrate, troubleshoot, and repair various plant process instrumentation related to temperature, pressure, flow, voltage, and other plant process variables. fundamental understanding of computer networks is desirable. candidates should also possess demonstrated troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, an ability to think logically and systematically. knowledge & understanding with the principles of: safety integrity level (sil), safety instrumented system (sis), safety instrumented function (sif), supervisory control and data acquisition (scada). knowledge of industry codes and standards applicable to oil and gas and refining industries (api, isa, nec / iec, nfpa, asme, etc.) and preferably also saudi aramco standards and working practices. experience and knowledge in the technology, design, and operation of air separation, hyco, gasification & helium process systems preferred. knowledgeable in process safety, health, and local environmental requirements. a strong commitment to employee involvement, team building and diversity. able to communicate between management, operations, maintenance, customers. proficiency in english speaking and writing, arabic language skills is a plus. demonstrated leadership, organizational, computer and interpersonal skills combined with good communications skills (written and verbal) in english a must. formal training and experience with six sigma processes and continuous improvement tools a plus. we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over distribution and broad channels? join our dynamic team and play a key role in driving growth and success in our organization. the distribution sales manager will be responsible for driving sales through a broad channel and distribution network, including distributors, resellers, and strategic partners. this role requires effective relationship management, the development of channel strategies, and the implementation of sales programs to expand the company's market presence and increase revenue. the ideal candidate will possess strong communication, negotiation, and strategic planning skills, with experience in managing large and diverse partner ecosystems. about the team the distribution sales manager will join the channel & oem emerging markets team at nutanix. this team is primarily focused on fostering growth and driving sales through strategic partnerships across the assigned region. the culture of this team is built on collaboration, continuous learning, and a passion for achieving ambitious goals that positively impact both the organization and its partners. you will report to the director - channel & oem emerging markets, who emphasizes a balance between high-level strategy and day-to-day relationship-building. this leadership style fosters an environment where team members feel empowered, supported, and motivated to contribute to the channel ecosystem. your role channel strategy development develop and implement a comprehensive channel/distribution sales strategy that aligns with the company’s overall business goals. identify and evaluate potential channel partners (distributors, resellers, vars, etc.) and establish strategic relationships to grow market share. create and execute go-to-market plans for the top broad channel partners. create velocity through distribution, own & manage the distribution joint business plan including qbr’s to monitor progress partner recruitment and onboarding build & develop existing partners processes. ensure partners are equipped with the necessary sales and marketing tools to effectively represent the company. relationship management cultivate strong, long-term relationships with channel partners to maintain a positive, productive partnership. focus on long-term growth strategies for channel partners, ensuring the sustainability and scalability of the ecosystem sales performance monitoring and reporting own and manage the targets with broad channel partners, track and analyze channel sales performance through key metrics such as revenue, market penetration, and sales growth. prepare and deliver regular performance reports including insights on opportunities and challenges within the channel. regular cadence with partners to give feedback and support to optimize their sales performance. channel marketing support work with partners on co-marketing initiatives, including joint promotions, events, and campaigns to generate incremental revenue. leverage the partner program and other special promotions to motivate channel partners to achieve sales targets. market intelligence and competitive analysis conduct regular analysis of competitor channel strategies, identifying strengths, weaknesses, and potential areas for growth or differentiation. keep track of market trends and emerging technologies to help adjust channel strategies and stay competitive. cross-functional collaboration work closely with internal teams, including sales, marketing, product, and operations, to align on channel strategy and ensure seamless execution. relay valuable feedback from partners to the company’s internal teams to help shape the business development, customer support, and sales strategies. what you will bring 6+ years of experience in channel sales, distribution, or partner management, with a proven track record of driving sales growth through indirect sales channels. strong negotiation and relationship management skills. excellent communication and presentation abilities. analytical mindset, with the ability to track, measure, and analyze channel performance. ability to develop and implement channel sales programs and strategies. proficiency in crm tools, sales enablement platforms, and ms office suite. strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. willingness to travel members in a dynamic and engaging work environment. being physically present allows for seamless teamwork and direct access to resources that support your success. additional team-specific guidance and norms will be provided by your manager.

agencies as required. · management of security assessments and reviews of baessa operations/locations as required by company (air and group), hmg and saudi arabian government (sag) policies and description: about ogilvy ogilvy has been creating impact for brands through iconic, culture-changing, value-driving ideas since the company was founded by david ogilvy 75 years ago. it builds on that rich legacy through borderless creativity – innovating at the intersections of its advertising, public relations, relationship design, consulting, and health capabilities with experts collaborating seamlessly across over 120 offices in nearly 90 countries. ogilvy currently ranks as the #1 global agency network for creative excellence and effectiveness by warc, signifying its ability to deliver creative solutions that drive unreasonable impact for clients and communities. ogilvy is a wpp company (nyse: wpp). for more information, visit ogilvy.com, and follow us on linkedin, x, instagram, and facebook. the senior digital strategist will be a key player of the c2 intelligence team in south africa, increasing the awareness of our offering and growing the business. reporting directly to data & intelligence director. the senior digital strategist will help the team deliver the work to the highest standards by building and leading data informed strategies. working closely with other departments (creative, strategy, experience), other agencies across the ogilvy network, and stakeholders from wpp organisation. the senior digital strategist must be an expert in the full range of digital and social media disciplines and channels. they will drive the data strategy within the team and help translate the analysis into actionable insights and recommendations. excellent strategic thinking and executive communication skills are required. key responsibilities: development of digital marketing strategies using data and technology in line with clients’ objectives translate the data analysis and research into actionable insights and recommendations for our client portfolio (direct, ogilvy and wpp network) work with the team of data analysts and provide them with necessary feedback, support and guidance own projects and clients to deliver the work to world class standards, and to make sure that decisions and actions are informed with data analyse social and digital data by using 3rd party tools (e.g. synthesio, sprinklr, unmetric, profiler, social lab proprietary tools, gwi etc…) based on particular need research through platforms available thanks to wpp contracts (e.g. emarketer, warc, forrester, mintel) using segmentation and other relevant data to develop audience persona’s and clearly defined, targetable audiences across digital channels support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers are ‘saying’, ‘sharing’ and ‘searching’ help to create new, commercially viable data products collaborate with wpp and external data providers design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations which are aimed to answer business questions client facing for the presentation of intelligence work contribute to the new business projects across the network lead training and coaching in the intelligence field for the team and for the broader network qualifications and skills: min 5 years of experience in digital strategy / research / data analysis experience in strategy consulting and/or marketing strategy across multiple industries and in an agency environment strong research skills - understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings towards actionable recommendations experience in social listening, social data analytics, social strategic planning, digital benchmarking, audience analysis and first-party data analytics candidate must have data analytical skills and spreadsheet capabilities; can build detailed business case/roi modelling ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team proven ability to bring strategic challenges to life in a way that convinces and inspires creative teams and clients offer: fulltime job within a growing and trendsetting agency global client portfolio attractive package and benefits continuous trainings and growth opportunities hybrid work policy at ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. we believe in building powerful teams with purpose. this means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. this is central to our mantra of borderless creativity. equal opportunity employer. ogilvy considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. applicants from the united states can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "know your rights" and pay transparency posters by clicking here. if you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at accommodations@ogilvy.com. please note that this contact is only for candidates who are requesting accommodation. emails for other purposes, including application status requests, will not receive a response.
